snippet: Residents of four City Council districts weighed in on how to spend public money for neighborhood improvements, with a Brooklyn school’s needs among the winners.
abstract: Proposal to improve children's bathrooms at Public School 124 in Park Slope, Brooklyn, wins the most votes in participatory budgeting experiment New York City; experiment, in which residents of four City Council districts proposed ways to spend roughly $1 million of their council member's budgets, was intended to involve disenfranchised members of the public as well as finance neighborhood improvement projects.
lead_paragraph: Residents of four City Council districts weighed in on how to spend public money for neighborhood improvements, with a Brooklyn school’s needs among the winners.

headline.print_headline: The Voters Speak: Yes to Bathrooms
headline.seo: Voters Speak in Budget Experiment, Saying Yes to Bathrooms
headline.main: The Voters Speak: Yes to Bathrooms
